result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary H. Soban was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mary H. Soban is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mary H. Soban was found guilty of Violate State/County Institution Laws [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to current jail sentence

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Upon release from current sentence in Sauk Co. Jai, DE to report to P&P that day or the next day if business hours are over for the day.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary H. Soban

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary H. Soban in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Mary H. Soban in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty O'Rourke states motion to dismiss is being withdrawn as matter is now resolved.  State moves to amend 946.73 as a repeater w/NC plea.  Atty O'Rourke states recs.  Court requests clarifications.  State responds.  Court grants amendment.  DE asks question on counsel.  Court

Ct 1:  NC as amended to 946.73 as a repeater
12 mos probation consecutive to current jail sentence
Conditions of probation:
$443.00 fine/costs including surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided unless that has already been done in another matter
Treatment/counseling per agent
Upon release from current sentence in Sauk Co Jail, DE to report to Probatin and Parole that day or the next day if business hours are over for the day
Ct 2:  Dismissed
no possession of controlled substances w/o valid prescription

Pre-trial conference on February 28, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on March 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Mary H. Soban appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. ORourke requests PA bond.   Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
